text: Sawyer County is a county in the U.S. state of Wisconsin. As of 2020, 18,074 people lived there. Its county seat is Hayward. ==History== The county is named for Philetus Sawyer. He was a Representative and Senator for Wisconsin in the 19th century. ==Geography== The county has a total area of . Of this, is land and (6.95%) is water. ==Cities, villages, and towns== ===Cities=== *Hayward ===Villages=== *Couderay *Exeland *Radisson *Winter ===Towns=== *Bass Lake *Couderay (town) *Draper *Edgewater *Hayward (town) *Hunter *Lenroot *Meadowbrook *Meteor *Ojibwa *Radisson (town) *Round Lake *Sand Lake *Spider Lake *Weirgor *Winter (town) ===Unincorporated communities=== *Chief Lake *Draper *Edgewater *Hauer *Hay Stack Corner *Lemington *Little Round Lake *Loretta *Meteor *New Post *Northwoods Beach *Ojibwa *Oxbo *Phipps *Reserve *Seeley *Stone Lake (partial) *Weirgor *Wooddale *Yarnell ==References== ==Other websites== *Sawyer County *Chippewa Flowage Fishing Report Category:1880s establishments in Wisconsin Category:1885 establishments in the United States
title: Sawyer County, Wisconsin
